Text.Value: That lot on the bridge are out for blood. Hope your disguise holds, if you try to get past.
Nobody. Just another hrasting fool trying to stay alive. There's plenty of us around.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

Text.Value: Who are you?
Your friends at the bridge are too much for me to take on... but I reckon I can handle you.
I have no interest in harming you, unless you force my hand.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if the player has the REALLY_GITHYANKI tag

Text.Value: Listen - avoid the bridge. I doubt a fight with that lot would go your way, no offence.

EditorData.logicalname: Too low level for chokepoint & act1b

Text.Value: I might've been concerned, had I the slightest idea who 'they' are...
I go my own way. Alone.
First and last warning - lower that weapon.
It's a disguise. I'm not really a gith.
... all right. I'm leaving. I have to get to Baldur's Gate. Don't follow. And not a word to them.
I won't let you warn them.
Leave.
Lower your weapon. I shall let no istik stand between me and my rightful cleansing.
I am Lae'zel of K'liir. You will let me pass.
Come on then, mragreshem!
They're out for blood. I hope you're in good standing with them.
Don't follow me - find your own way.
So... you not looking to make trouble for me, are you? Whatever you are?
Seems you have good survival instincts - maybe you should join me instead.
They're out for blood. Unless you're in good standing with them, I'd keep clear.
'Another one'? Explain yourself.
I am Lae'zel of K'liir. You will let me pass.
I am not with them. But perhaps they will listen to me.
They may be my kin. I will investigate.
I'll drop it when you're dead.
Spare me. There's bigger problems right now that my manners. Look...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.

Text.Value: Your hrasting friends are swarming all over the bridge down there.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

Text.Value: And who are you exactly?
I didn't say that...
What? Why...?
That bridge was going to be my passage to Baldur's Gate. To safety. Now I've to find another way.
Those things you're masquerading as. Armed to the teeth. And they've a dragon.
Let's see if you're actually as tough as your disguise makes you... come on!
... unless you're looking for a fight, that is.
Got more important things to watch than my hrasting tongue. Look...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.
EditorData.NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

Text.Value: I'm leaving. Don't follow. Don't tell them you saw me.
What are you doing?! Hold up, before they see you, mragreshem!

EditorData.logicalname: Player does not look like a Githyanki

Text.Value: What? Why...? Never mind. I don't want to know.
I'm going to find another way around. You ought to do the same.
What? Just follow you around?
Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

Text.Value: ... aren't you with that other lot? Down at the bridge? The ones with the dragon?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling gestures to/camera highlights the chokepoint githyanki.

Text.Value: That lot are too much for me to take on... but I reckon I can handle you, mragreshem.
Now I've got to find another way around. Take your chances against that lot if you like.
... good. I've enough trouble as it is - look at that lot down there.
I'm getting out of here. There's got to be another way to Baldur's Gate. Good luck.
That lot are swarming all over the bridge. I don't know what they want, but it can't be good.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.
EditorData.NodeContext: Referring to a bridge a short distance away. Some gith raiders have barricaded it.

Text.Value: No, you are safe.
If there are gith at the bridge, they're nothing to me.
Actually forget it. I need to get moving; there has to be another way to Baldur's Gate.
You're the mragreshem for taking that tone with me.
That's how you want it... fine.
Whatever you just called me, I didn't like the sound of it. Watch your tongue.
Calm yourself. I am not who you think I am.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node if the player is Planar and looks githyanki, but is not in fact githyanki.

Text.Value: Now I've got to find another way around. If you're smart, you will too. You're no match for that lot.
What? You going to try get past that lot? Better you than me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.
EditorData.NodeContext: 'That lot' being a band of gith warriors guarding a nearby bridge.

Text.Value: Attack.
What, apart from the dragon? Look...

EditorData.NodeContext: Turns to look at the chokepoint

Text.Value: Nobody. Just another hrasting fool trying to get to Baldur's Gate in one piece.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

Text.Value: Look, down there...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.

Text.Value: Come on, mragreshem! I'll take my chances against you than your friends on the bridge!
I was counting on crossing that bridge and heading to Baldur's Gate. To safety.
I'd keep clear of that lot on the bridge unless you think your disguise'll fool them.
I doubt a fight against them would go your way.

EditorData.logicalname: Too low level for chokepoint & act1b

Text.Value: I'm going to have to be sure you stay quiet, mragreshem.
I have kin nearby? I should seek them out.
Take it easy, I'm only disguised as a gith.
What's the matter?
They are nothing to me.
Then we've a problem. I can't have you running off to tell your friends about me.
All right. Maybe we don't have a problem then. Maybe.
You're not like that lot at the bridge. I reckon I can handler you... come on!
Leave.
Come on then, mragreshem!

Synopsis: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
